alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 4:52PM EDT until June 16 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE EDWARD, WEST CENTRAL DINWIDDIE, NORTHERN LUNENBURG AND SOUTHERN NOTTOWAY COUNTIES... At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blackstone, Victoria, Nottoway, Fort Barfoot, Green Bay, Dewitt, Murdocks, Irby, The Falls, Dominy Corner, Rubermount, Blackstone Airport, Forkland, Wellville, Oliveville, Nutbush, Twin Lakes State Park, Prince Edward Lake, Prince Edward Station and Scholfield. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
